sentences: Kaks meest l채ksid metsa ja said haavata, kuid 체ks neist j천udis siiski maas.
P채rast tormu oli palju puusid maas.
context: In Estonian, 'maas' is the adessive case form of 'maa', meaning 'ground' or 'earth'. It's used to indicate that something is located on the ground surface or has fallen/lie down. The adessive case typically shows location on/in something, so here it indicates position relative to the ground.
